data.title: Luca Maestri
data.text:
Chief Financial Officer of Apple Inc.

Luca Maestri (born 14 October 1963) is an Italian businessman. He is the chief financial officer (CFO) of Apple Inc..[1]

Education

[edit]

Maestri has a Bachelor of Economics from LUISS University in Rome and a Master of Science in Management from Boston University Questrom School of Business.

Career

[edit]

Before Apple

[edit]

The first global company where Maestri worked was at General Motors. After that, in 2009, he worked at Nokia Networks and at Xerox as a CFO.

Apple

[edit]

In 2014, after working at Apple Inc. as vice president of finance and corporate controller, he was appointed the position of CFO.[2][3][4] Along with being the chief financial officer he will also assume the responsibility of principal accounting officer. Upon being appointed CFO, he was issued 6,337 restricted stock units (currently worth approximately $4 million). Maestri's official salary is $1 million but he is eligible for Apple's performance-based cash bonus program which increases his salary. In 2014, he took in a salary of $14 million and in 2015, he took in a salary of $25.3 million.[5] Based on SEC filings, from 2018 to 2020, Maestri's average compensation was $26 million.[6]
